title: Riot please bring client to front when it is your time to ban for christ sake
body:
When Im 3-6th baner I tent to be looking at other windows.  The Client makes NO sound or change when it is my turn to ban and ONLY get a 10s warning with the count down sound.

PLEASE just force client to the front like you do when it is your time to pick a champ.

This would stop so many accidental dodges from happening

replies.body: They've already stated that this is a bug, and it sounds like it should be fixed next patch: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official/zJ4kqlHZ-the-future-of-new-champ-select
That's the problem. Next patch. It shouldn't take them more than a day do a hotfix on it. They shouldn't need to have to put it in a patch. Just fix it and send it out.
Hotfixes have the potential to cause more issues. I would rather them take the extra time to make sure everything is working properly than to have them put out a hotfix that causes more bugs.

Hotfixes are for major game health issues that need to be addressed immediately - not for the convenience of players who think client not being in the foreground when it's their time to ban is annoying and it should be dealt with immediately.
The whole point of their new Champion Select experience is for you to be engaged in the entire select, not being 6th pick and giving you time to take a power nap.

This issue can easily be avoided if you just sat through these 3-5 minutes, not facebooking a catfish.
I realize this is a bug but you can avoid the problem if you aren't lazy or uninterested into wasting 3-5 minutes in the select, but wasting 30+ minutes on the game anyway.
Then we're gonna see Katarina W damaging pink wards. Cuz you know, spaghetti.

Exactly what Alleo said. All we can do right now is pay more attention to when it's your turn to ban and wait for them to fix it. I don't want more bugs because of this one little problem. Yes, it's annoying, but it's better than having tons of other small bugs as well, or maybe even big ones
It should be a hotfix. But oh well ...
Hot fixes often cause more issues than they solve. There's no point of taking a risk with such a small bug.

When you wait 10+ minutes just for a match to be found, then you're not even part of the banning process, you have to wait a few minutes for the champion intent picks plus banning phase, of which you can't even be guaranteed to have people lock in or purposefully dodge, then you have another 5-10 minutes accepting AFK checks for matches found that are being spammed in succession because at least one person didn't click, then back to the intent/ban phase, and then it's a flip of the coin of whether someone's going to troll, argue for their primary role they didn't get when the other person's secondary wasn't even the other person's, oops....someone didn't lock a ban or pick in time, time to wait again for god only knows how long...........

You can't really fault people for not wanting to glue their eyes to that for EASILY upwards of an hour or more. Some nights, even in Bronze V, it will take me an hour and a half of this back-and-forth just to get to the final pick before the match...and someone dodges. That's when I just say screw it and play a different game altogether.
I never have issues with this because I keep my client in the foreground or check back every few seconds. What needs your attention more than keeping track of bans and picks?

I normally vote down threads that directly address Riot, but removing this feature in the recent update was a mistake.

Now, the shortened timers on PBE right now are a very positive change, but not pinging people where they have an action to take during selection is still a problem.

I don't play ranked anymore, so accidental dodges don't really affect me.  A 6 min penalty for dodging because I was reading a website while players take 30 secs each to ban a champion in a bronze/silver level Norms game isn't the end of the world.

Taking the full 700 secs for selection norms is like drawing out a 4/8 limit game in poker.  Make a decision and move.  It's no limit WOSP play.

Edit: No design decision is going to make me care about what players are saying if they choose a double adc bot lane or a thresh jungle.  I just want to get in game as quickly as possible.  Either people build a decent comp or the game ends at 20 and you move on.  No amount of selection talk is going to fix the dumb team comp stuff.
